messages.title: Personal
messages.content: Simon Hughes, who lives just off the Old Kent Road, has spent more than 30 years fighting for our community. He is a tried and tested constituency MP with experience of getting things done. Simon looks after all of the people all of the time. Nearly everybody knows somebody who has been helped by Simon Hughes.

messages.title: Community Campaigner
messages.content: Transport for all our community, Keeping Millwall in Bermondsey, Rotherhithe walking and cycle bridge, Genuinely affordable housing for local people, Protecting NHS services for all.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon helped deliver the Southwark and Bermondsey Jubilee line stations and the C10 bus. Now, he is leading the fight for the Bakerloo line extension to benefit all who travel near Old Kent Road and Tower Bridge Road.
From the beginning, Simon has fought Labour’s plan for compulsory purchase of the land around the Den which could force the club to leave the area.
Unlike Labour, Simon continues to push for the Rotherhithe Garden Bridge, and instead fought for improved walking and cycling linking Rotherhithe to Canary Wharf and Bermondsey.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Genuinely affordable housing for local people
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon has fought Labour on local issues and will increase the number of genuinely affordable homes for local people by fighting landowners and councils selling off existing housing.
Simon fought to keep Guy’s Hospital open, to open the new Cancer Centre, and to keep the 24-hour mental health clinic at the Maudsley Hospital.

issues.health: Protecting NHS services for all, Simon fought to keep Guy’s Hospital open, to open the new Cancer Centre, and to keep the 24-hour mental health clinic at the Maudsley Hospital.

Keeping Millwall in Bermondsey, From the beginning, Simon has fought Labour’s plan for compulsory purchase of the land around the Den which could force the club to leave the area.

leaflet.personalStatement: Simon Hughes, who lives just off the Old Kent Road, has spent more than 30 years fighting for our community.

politicalExperience.achievements: Most Motivated MP, Green MP of the Year, Co-Chairman on Human Rights, Deputy Leader of the Liberal Democrats, Minster of State for Justice and Civil Liberties.

endorsements.endorsement: Simon has always been there for me and my family. Every member of our community owes him a debt of gratitude for standing up for our needs, and fighting for our rights.
Simon gave our family a voice when we needed it the most. Whether it’s his work for our family, the way he fights for our community or the way he fights for everyone.

examples: Simon has given several awards including Most Motivated MP and Green MP of the Year.
Simon helped tens of thousands of local people with individual problems and local issues including schools, jobs and homes.
Genuinely affordable housing for local people

Simon gave our family a voice when we needed it the most. Whether it’s his work for our family, the way he fights for our community or the way he fights for everyone.

Simon has fought Labour’s plan for compulsory purchase of the land around the Den which could force the club to leave the area.
